title: Royals manager Matt Quatraro gets new contract through 2029
snippets: Royals manager Matt Quatraro, who went 82-80 last season, has agreed to a three-year contract extension with Kansas City though 2029.
Kansas City Royals tacked 3 years onto manager Matt Quatraro's contract, taking him through 2030. He's led them to one playoff berth in three seasons.

KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) — Kansas City Royals manager Matt Quatraro has agreed to a three-year contract extension though 2029. His deal includes a team option for 2030, the Royals said Sunday. Quatraro replaced Mike Matheny after the 2022 season and has led the Royals to a 224-262 record in three years. Kansas City improved from 56-106 during Quatraro’s first season to 86-76 in 2024, and the Royals then went 82-80 last year for their first consecutive winning seasons since 2013-15. Quatraro finished second to Cleveland's Stephen Vogt in 2024 AL Manager of the Year voting. ___ AP MLB:...
The Kansas City Royals are showing faith in their manager after consecutive winning seasons.

summary: Researchers have developed a CAR T-cell therapy that targets senescent cells in aging intestines, leading to improved gut healing, reduced inflammation, and better nutrient absorption in mice. Separately, new findings challenge the belief that Alzheimer’s disease is irreversible, suggesting it may be possible to reverse aspects of the condition. Both advances could impact future treatments for aging-related diseases.
